node.projectDescription: The Black Desert Online Grinding Tracker is a comprehensive utility designed for avid players of the MMORPG, Black Desert Online. This project facilitates seamless tracking and management of in-game grinding sessions. It encompasses features such as session-specific data storage, experience gains, item drops, earnings monitoring, and a marketplace module to observe fluctuations in marketplace items. By offering the capacity to edit, delete, and analyze sessions, players can elevate their gameplay experience and make well-informed decisions during their Black Desert Online escapades.

node.skillDescription: First usage is dated in BDO Grind Tracker. I used to learn on basic easy examples until decided to build a game statistics site for Black Desert Online.

Started using it first in High school where I learned basic usage and syntax while building a simple website as a final project. Then I started to use it more as a structure for more complex websites.

Started using it first in High school where I learned basic usage and syntax while building a simple website as a final project. Then I started to use it more as a structure for more complex websites.
Learned basics of CSS in High school then used it in most of the projects while slowly using it's preprocessors. Nothing exceptional just basics with ability to figure out more then "center a div."

When I got into a project around managing gaming server I used Node.js first as a Discord Bot developement language. Then I used it in "Black Desert Online Tracking Tool" as a Backend. API? Yes. Function with Database? Yes. Discord Bot working? Yes.
University course experience not much to see here just I know about it existing and basics. Some projects in works that are just for fun and learning.
Basics got the example projects set up.
Started learning with React.js as a Database for "Black Desert Online Grind Tool" project. Basics learned. Can connect to database and use it. Most used is "Mongoose". No-Sql database!
Used in University PHP course project as database for social network final project.
